1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 """
3 This code serves as the generic RobotController
4 class.
5 """
6 
7 import rospy
8 import numpy as np
9 import intera_interface
10 from RobotArm import RobotArm
11 
12 
13 class RobotController(object):
14  """
15  Robot controller object.
16  """
17  def __init__(self, num_joints, is_sim=True,
18  controller_names=None):
19  """
20  robot controller for n joints.
21 
22  Arguments
23  ---------
24  `num_joints`: `int` - number of joints on the robot.
25 
26  `is_sim`: `bool` - whether the robot is being controlled in sim or not.
27 
28  `controller_names`: `List[str]` - list of the controller names.
29  """
30  self.is_sim = is_sim
31  self.arm = self.get_arm(num_joints, is_sim)
32  self.pose_name = ''
33 
34  def get_arm(self, num_joints, is_sim=True):
35  """
36  gets the robotic limb.
37 
38  Arguments
39  ---------
40  `num_joints`: `int` - number of joints on the robot
41 
42  `is_sim`: `bool`: if the robot is controlled in simulation or not
43 
44  Returns
45  -------
46  `RobotArm` - a robot arm object.
47 
48  """
49  return RobotArm(num_joints=num_joints, is_sim=is_sim)
50 
51  @property
52  def joint_names(self):
53  """
54  get joint names.
55 
56  Returns
57  -------
58  `List[str]`: list of joint names.
59  """
60  return self.arm.joint_names()
61 
62  @property
63  def joint_velocities(self):
64  """
65  get joint velocities.
66 
67  Returns
68  -------
69  `List[float]`: list of joint velocities.
70  """
71  return self.arm.joint_velocities()
72 
73  @property
74  def joint_angles(self):
75  """
76  get joint angles.
77 
78  Returns
79  -------
80  `List[float]`: list of joint angles.
81  """
82  return self.arm.joint_angles()
83 
84  def joint_angle(self, joint_name):
85  """
86  get joint angle givem `joint_name`.
87 
88  Arguments
89  ---------
90  `joint_name`: `str` - the joint name.
91 
92  Returns
93  -------
94  `float`: joint angle of the specified joint name.
95  """
96  return self.arm.joint_angle(joint_name)
97 
98  def joint_velocity(self, joint_name):
99  """
100  get joint velocity given `joint_name`.
101 
102  Arguments
103  ---------
104  `joint_name`: `str` - the joint name.
105 
106  Returns
107  -------
108  `float`: joint velocity of the specified joint name.
109  """
110  return self.arm.joint_velocity(joint_name)
111 
112  def set_joint_position_speed(self, speed=1.0):
113  """
114  change joint position speed.
115 
116  Arguments
117  ---------
118  `speed`: `float` - desired (max) speed of the joints.
119 
120  Returns
121  -------
122  `None`, as this hasn't been implemented yet.
123  """
124  return self.arm.set_joint_position_speed(speed)
125 
126  def send_once(self):
127  """
128  sends a trajectory message once. This is a hardcoded trajectory
129  and should only be used for test purposes.
130  """
131  traj = np.zeros((1, 3, 7))
132  self.arm.set_joint_trajectory(traj)
133  rospy.sleep(1)
134  self.arm.set_joint_trajectory(traj)
135  rospy.sleep(1)
136 
137  def publish_positions(self, joint_positions, sleep=2.0):
138  """
139  moves robot to specificed `joint_positions`.
140 
141  Arguments
142  ---------
143  `joint_positions`: `List[float]` - list of desired joint positions.
144 
145  `sleep`: `float`: amount of sleep until the arm will stop.
146  """
147  self.arm.move_to_joint_positions(joint_positions, sleep)
148 
149  def send_velocities(self, joint_velocities):
150  """
151  sends a velocity command.
152 
153  Arguments
154  ---------
155  `joint_velocities`: `List[float]` - list of desired velocities.
156  """
157  self.arm.set_joint_velocities(joint_velocities)
158 
159  def publish_velocities(self, joint_velocities, sleep=2.0):
160  """
161  unlike `send_velocities`, this function will
162  command joints to move at specified velocities for `sleep`
163  seconds before stopping.
164 
165  Arguments
166  ---------
167  `joint_velocities`: `List[float]` - list of joint velocities
168 
169  `sleep`: `float` - time to sleep.
170  """
171  self.arm.set_joint_velocities(joint_velocities)
172  rospy.sleep(sleep)
173  self.arm.set_joint_velocities(np.zeros(self.arm.num_joints))
174 
175  def publish_trajectory(self, positions, velocities, accelerations, sleep):
176  """
177  publishes a robot trajectory. Takes care of positions, velocities,
178  and accelerations, which are more intuitive than a 3-d tensor.
179 
180  Arguments
181  ---------
182  `positions`: List[List[float]] - a *2-d* matrix of joint positions, where the shape is
183  (num_points, num_joints).
184 
185  `velocities`: List[List[float]] - a *2-d* matrix of joint velocities, where the shape is
186  (num_points, num_joints).
187 
188  `accelerations`: List[List[float]] - a *2-d* matrix of joint accelerations, where the shape is
189  (num_points, num_joints).
190 
191  `sleep`: `float` - how much time to sleep for.
192  """
193  # shape is amount of poses, 3 rows for pos,vel,acc, with num_joints
194  traj = np.zeros((len(positions), 3, self.arm.num_joints))
195  for idx, (pos, vel, acc) in enumerate(zip(positions, velocities, accelerations)):
196  traj[idx] = np.vstack((pos, vel, acc))
197  self.arm.set_joint_trajectory(traj)
198  rospy.sleep(sleep)
199 
200  def set_positions_list(self, poses, sleep):
201  """
202  sets position list.
203 
204  `poses`: List - containing the following -
205  - Each entry in `poses` consists of three components: positions,
206  _, and the pose_name.
207 
208  `sleep`: `float`: The amount of time to sleep for.
209  """
210  for each_pose in poses:
211  positions, _, pose_name = each_pose[0], each_pose[1], each_pose[2] # noqa: F841
212  self.pose_name = pose_name
213  self.publish_positions(positions, sleep)
214 
215  def set_velocities_list(self, poses, sleep):
216  """
217  sets velocities list.
218 
219  `poses`: List - containing the following -
220  - Each entry in `poses` consists of three components: _,
221  velocities, and the pose_name.
222 
223  `sleep`: `float`: The amount of time to sleep for.
224  """
225  for each_pose in poses:
226  _, velocities, pose_name = each_pose[0], each_pose[1], each_pose[2] # noqa: F841
227  self.pose_name = pose_name
228  self.publish_velocities(velocities, sleep)
229 
230  def set_trajectory_list(self, poses, sleep):
231  """
232  sets trajectory list.
233 
234  Arguments
235  ---------
236  `poses`: List - containing the following -
237  - Each entry in `poses` consists of three components: positions,
238  velocities, and the pose_name.
239 
240  `sleep`: `float`: The amount of time to sleep for.
241  """
242  for each_pose in poses:
243  positions, velocities, pose_name = each_pose[0], each_pose[1], each_pose[2]
244  accelerations = np.zeros(7)
245  self.pose_name = pose_name
246  self.publish_trajectory(positions, velocities, accelerations, sleep)
247 
248 
249 class PandaController(RobotController):
250  """
251  PandaController class
252  """
253  def __init__(self, num_joints=7, is_sim=True):
254  """
255  the Panda Controller class.
256 
257  Arguments
258  ---------
259  `num_joints`: `int` - number of joints.
260 
261  `is_sim`: `bool` - whether the robot is being controlled in simulation or not.
262  """
263  super(PandaController, self).__init__(num_joints, is_sim)
264 
265 
266 class SawyerController(RobotController):
267  """
268  SawyerController class.
269  """
270  def __init__(self, num_joints=7, is_sim=True, limb_name="right"):
271  """
272  the Sawyer Controller class.
273 
274  Arguments
275  ---------
276  `num_joints`: `int` - number of joints.
277 
278  `is_sim`: `bool` - whether the robot is being controlled in simulation or not.
279 
280  `limb_name`: `str` - the limb name of the arm for Sawyer.
281  """
282  self.limb_name = limb_name
283  super(SawyerController, self).__init__(num_joints, is_sim)
284  self.positions = {name: 0.0 for name in self.joint_names}
285  self.velocities = {name: 0.0 for name in self.joint_names}
286 
287  def get_arm(self, num_joints, is_sim=True):
288  """
289  gets the arm for Sawyer.
290 
291  Arguments
292  ---------
293  `num_joints`: `int` - number of joints on the arm.
294 
295  `is_sim`: `bool` - whether the robot is being controlled in sim or not.
296 
297  Returns
298  -------
299  `arm`: `intera_interface.Limb` - gets the limb for Sawyer
300  """
301 
302  arm = intera_interface.Limb(self.limb_name)
303  self._rs = intera_interface.RobotEnable(intera_interface.CHECK_VERSION)
304  self._init_state = self._rs.state().enabled
305  self._rs.enable()
306  self.num_joints = num_joints
307  rospy.sleep(2)
308  return arm
309 
310  def send_once(self):
311  """
312  sends a trajectory message once.
313  """
314  positions = [0] * self.num_joints
315  velocities = [0] * self.num_joints
316  accelerations = [0] * self.num_joints
317 
318  self.arm.set_joint_trajectory(self.joint_names(), positions, velocities, accelerations)
319 
320  def update_position_vec(self, positions):
321  """
322  updates the positions that will be sent to Sawyer.
323 
324  Arguments
325  ---------
326  `positions`: `List[float]` - the list of joint positions to send
327  to Sawyer.
328  """
329  for joint_name, position in zip(self.joint_names, positions):
330  self.positions[joint_name] = float(position)
331 
332  def update_velocity_vec(self, velocities):
333  """
334  updates the velocities that will be sent to Sawyer.
335 
336  Arguments
337  ---------
338  `velocities`: `List[float]` - the list of joint velocities to send
339  to Sawyer.
340  """
341  for joint_name, velocity in zip(self.joint_names, velocities):
342  self.velocities[joint_name] = float(velocity)
343 
344  def publish_positions(self, joint_positions, sleep=2.0):
345  """
346  moves robot to specified `joint_positions`.
347 
348  Arguments
349  ---------
350  `joint_positions`: `List[float]` - desired joint positions.
351 
352  `sleep`: `float` - sleeps for that amount of time.
353  """
354  self.update_position_vec(joint_positions)
355  self.arm.move_to_joint_positions(self.positions, sleep)
356 
357  def send_velocities(self, joint_velocities):
358  """
359  sends a velocity command.
360 
361  Arguments
362  ----------
363  `joint_velocities`: `List[float]` - list of desired velocities.
364  """
365  self.update_velocity_vec(joint_velocities)
366  self.arm.set_joint_velocities(self.velocities)
367 
368  def publish_velocities(self, joint_velocities, sleep=2.0):
369  """
370  unlike `send_velocities`, this function will
371  command joints to move at specified velocities for `sleep`
372  seconds before stopping.
373 
374  Arguments
375  ---------
376  `joint_velocities`: `List[float]` - desired joint velocities.
377 
378  `sleep`: `float` - amount of time to sleep for before stopping.
379  """
380  self.update_velocity_vec(joint_velocities)
381 
382  self.arm.set_joint_velocities(self.velocities)
383  self.update_velocity_vec(joint_velocities)
384 
385  rospy.sleep(sleep)
386  self.update_velocity_vec(np.zeros(self.num_joints))
387  self.arm.set_joint_velocities(self.velocities)
388 
389  def publish_trajectory(self, positions, velocities, accelerations, sleep=2.0):
390  """
391  publishes a robot trajectory. Takes care of positions, velocities,
392  and accelerations, which are more intuitive than a 3-d tensor.
393 
394  Arguments
395  ---------
396  `positions`: List[List[float]] - a *2-d* matrix of joint positions, where the shape is
397  (num_points, num_joints).
398 
399  `velocities`: List[List[float]] - a *2-d* matrix of joint velocities, where the shape is
400  (num_points, num_joints).
401 
402  `accelerations`: List[List[float]] - a *2-d* matrix of joint accelerations, where the shape is
403  (num_points, num_joints).
404 
405  `sleep`: `float` - how much time to sleep for.
406  """
407  # shape is amount of poses, 3 rows for pos,vel,acc, with num_joints
408  self.arm.set_joint_trajectory(self.joint_names, positions, velocities, accelerations)
409  rospy.sleep(sleep)
410 
411 
412 if __name__ == '__main__':
413  """
414  this is a simple example of creating a panda controller
415  and publishing positions to all of the joints.
416  """
417  rospy.init_node('robot_controller')
418  controller = PandaController(is_sim=True)
419 
420  # publish the "zero" positions of the Panda.
421  # note that one of the positions is not 0, due to the limits of the panda.
422  controller.publish_positions([0, 0, 0, -0.0698, 0, 0, 0])
